result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian Joseph Misovy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Provide a DNA sample. Pay a fine in the amount of $600.00 plus all court costs, fees, and surcharges including DNA and any victim surcharges. All applicable fees of supervision, this can be based on a budget plan. Pay all of the following by the end of supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitutiton be paid through collection by the DOC's from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of ES. DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens and breathalyzers as deemed appropriate.
- Obtain/maintain full-time employment/education/vocation.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian Joseph Misovy

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original PLEA AND SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (24 pages) commencing 07/31/2015 received and filed.  CH

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS and 6 MONTHS with 169 days credit; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR and 6 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program but IS eligible for the WI Substance Abuse program.  

Court ordered Intoxicated Driver Assessment; form filed; copy to defendant.

Court ordered defendant's operating privileges revoked for 3 YEARS with the mandatory reinstatement fee.  

Defendant's operating privilege for operation of Class D vehicles is restricted to operating vehicles that are equipped with an ignition interlock device; and each motor vehicle for which the defendant's name appears on the vehicle's certificate of title or registration must be equipped with an ignition interlock device beginning on the date the department issues any license and for a period of  3 YEARS thereafter.


Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens and breathalyzers as deemed appropriate.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Fine in the amount of $600.00; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA and any victim surcharges); 
All applicable fees of supervision, this can be based on a budget plan.
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.


Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Brian Joseph Misovy in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Brian Joseph Misovy in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea and sentencing.   On oral motion of the State, the Court ordered the Criminapl Complaint to reflect a location of I-43 southbound near National Avenue. 
As to Count 1: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Attorney Darryl E. Smith in court via telephone, defendant Brian Joseph Misovy not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter for Irene Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea hearing, however defense has an emergency and cannot proceed today.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Darryl E. Smith in court, defendant Brian Joseph Misovy not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests projected guilty plea date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Brian Joseph Misovy in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Brian Joseph Misovy in custody.  Megan Carmody for Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug tests, portable breathalyzers, and SCRAM.  No driving without a valid license. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Brian Joseph Misovy in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Defendant Brian Joseph Misovy in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
